ETYMOLOGY: From Portuguese varanda, possibly ultimately derived from Hindi varaṇḍā (porch, gallery) or Persian barandā (top-cover, roof). Adopted into English via India.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A roofed, open-air porch or gallery attached to the exterior of a building, often extending along one side and typically enclosed partially by a railing.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （通常指在房屋外墙一侧延伸的有屋顶的）走廊，阳台，凉台。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: They served afternoon tea on the veranda, overlooking the garden.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他们在凉台上供应下午茶，可以俯瞰花园。

REGISTER: General English, common in descriptions of architecture, especially in tropical or colonial settings.
